alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford; Floyd; Harrison; Jefferson; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 4:02AM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Harrison, Jefferson, Clark, east central Crawford, northern Floyd, Scott, southeastern Washington and northwestern Trimble Counties through 445 AM EST... At 401 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Vernon to 7 miles northeast of Carefree Town. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts between 40 to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Crawford, southeastern Washington, Jefferson, northern Floyd, Clark, Scott, northwestern Harrison Counties in south central Indiana and northwestern Trimble Counties in north central Kentucky, including the following locations... North Madison, Manville, Shorts Corner, Bradford, Clark Siding, Bryantsburg, Fairdale, Austin, Lexington and New Liberty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Crawford; Floyd; Harrison; Jefferson; Scott; Washington
